intro: Peltophorus divergens, commonly known as the common burrweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its upright, branched stems and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. The plant produces distinctive, spiny burrs that aid in seed dispersal by attaching to animals or clothing. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas. Peltophorus divergens is an annual herb that is widespread across temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere.
